citeinfo.title: Preliminary Assessment of Species Distributions in the Bering Sea Donut Hole

descript.abstract:
This 10-page document presents information on the distribution of over 200 invertebrates, fishes, marine mammals, and seabirds found in the donut hole region of the Bering Sea. Presence-absence data are included for the U.S. Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ), the USSR (now Russian) EEZ, and other Bering Sea waters. The data for each species are organized within four categories: 1) adult presence; 2) adult abundance; 3) reproduction; and 4) commercial fishing grounds. The information was compiled from the work done for NOAA's Bering, Chukchi, and Beaufort Seas Strategic Assessment Data Atlas and West Coast of North America Strategic Assessment Data Atlas.
NOAAServer Codes: [OL 72 55 -130 -168] ; nodateline obtain

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
